com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.HelpOverlay

Class DynamicHelpInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.HelpOverlay.DynamicHelpInterface

  • public class DynamicHelpInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows interaction with a Dynamic Help Overlay layout.

    • Constructor Summary

      Initializes a new instance of this object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DynamicHelpInterface

        public DynamicHelpInterface(android.widget.RelativeLayout linkedView,
                            java.util.ArrayList<HelpOverlayScene> scenes)
        Initializes a new instance of this object. This object has all default values and a null target View until otherwise specified.
        Parameters:
        linkedView - the RelativeLayout to manage. Must be non-null and an instance of a Dynamic Help Overlay layout. The view's Context will be used to set default properties for this object.
        scenes - the initial list of HelpOverlayScene objects to store in this object's internal queue. If set to null, the initial scene list will be empty.

    • Method Detail

      • addScene

        public void addScene(@NonNull
                     HelpOverlayScene scene)
        Adds a scene object to the scene list.
        Parameters:
        scene - the HelpOverlayScene object to add to the list

      • setLabelColor

        public void setLabelColor(int color)
        Sets the background color of the text label. Setting this to -1 will use the default color set in colors.xml.
        Parameters:
        color - the resource ID of the color to use as the label background

      • setLabelText

        public void setLabelText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets this object's label text. Setting this to null will use the default label text set in strings.xml.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to use for the label on this overlay

      • setMaxLabelWidth

        public void setMaxLabelWidth(int max)
        Sets the maximum width of the text label before wrapping around to another line. Values below 0 will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum width of the label in pixels

      • setTargetView

        public void setTargetView(android.view.View target)
        Sets this object's target View. This view will be 'highlighted' in the overlay. Cannot be the same as the linked view. Setting this to null will use manually set position values, if present.
        Parameters:
        target - the View to use as this object's highlight target

      • setManualValues

        public void setManualValues(float xPos,
                            float yPos,
                            int width,
                            int height)
        Sets manual values for the overlay's label/display pair. Any targeted View will override manually set values. Set the targeted View to null to enable manual values.
        Parameters:
        xPos - the X-position of the upper-left corner of the label/display pair in DIP (density-independent pixels)
        yPos - the Y-position of the upper-left corner of the label/display pair in DIP (density-independent pixels)
        width - the width of the display window in DIP (density-independent pixels)
        height - the height of the display window in DIP (density-independent pixels)

      • getScenes

        public java.util.ArrayList<HelpOverlayScene> getScenes()
        Gets the current list of stored scenes. Returns a copy, not a direct reference.
        Returns:
        a copy of the current scene list

      • clearSceneList

        public void clearSceneList()
        Clears the current internal scene list.

      • getLinkedView

        public android.widget.RelativeLayout getLinkedView()
        Gets this object's linked overlay layout.
        Returns:
        the RelativeLayout linked to this object

      • getLabelColor

        public int getLabelColor()
        Gets the background color of the text label.
        Returns:
        the resource ID of the color being used as the text label BG color

      • getLabelText

        public java.lang.String getLabelText()
        Gets the current label text.
        Returns:
        the String being used as the display label.

      • getMaxLabelWidth

        public int getMaxLabelWidth()
        Gets the text label's maximum line width before auto-wrapping.
        Returns:
        the label's max line width in pixels

      • getManualValues

        public float[] getManualValues()
        Gets the four manually set position/size values for this object.
        Returns:
        a length 4 Float array containing the following values, in this order: x-position, y-position, width, height. All values are in pixels.

      • getTargetView

        public android.view.View getTargetView()
        Gets this object's currently targeted View.
        Returns:
        the View that is currently being used as this object's target, or null if none is set

      • updateLinkedView

        public void updateLinkedView()
        Updates the display of the linked overlay view. Display window and associated label are moved to the targeted view or manually set coordinates, whichever has current priority. The label is checked for screen bounds clipping, and moved if necessary.

      • showOverlay

        public void showOverlay(int animation)
        Shows this overlay with its current settings. Calls updateLinkedView() after showing overlay. If the overlay is already showing, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        animation - the duration of the animation used when changing visibility in milliseconds. Set to <= 0 to disable animation. Animation used is an alpha fade.

      • hideOverlay

        public void hideOverlay(int animation)
        Hides this overlay. Hidden overlays keep their settings. If the overlay is already hidden, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        animation - the duration of the animation used when changing visibility in milliseconds. Set to <= 0 to disable animation. Animation used is an alpha fade.

      • showNextScene

        public void showNextScene(int animation)
        Shows the next scene in the scene queue. If the overlay is currently hidden, the overlay counter is reset to zero and the overlay is shown. If the currently displaying scene is the last in the queue, the overlay will be hidden. If the scene queue is empty or null, no action will be taken.
        Parameters:
        animation - if the overlay must be hidden or shown, the duration of the animation used in milliseconds. Set to <= 0 to disable animation. Animation used is an alpha fade.
